meanings.definition: Not having enough money to operate effectively.
meanings.sent1: The small business was underfinanced and struggled to stay open.
meanings.sent2: The underfinanced school couldn't afford new textbooks for the students.
meanings.sent3: The underfinanced zoo had to resort to using cardboard cutouts of animals.
meanings.sent4: Her underfinanced wardrobe consisted of hand-me-downs and thrift store finds.
meanings.sent5: The underfinanced charity relied on donations to support their cause.

meanings.sent1: The underfinanced project had to be put on hold due to budget constraints.
meanings.sent2: The underfinanced family struggled to make ends meet each month.
meanings.sent3: The underfinanced vacation turned into a camping trip in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The underfinanced car sputtered to a stop due to lack of maintenance.
meanings.sent5: The underfinanced city infrastructure was in dire need of repair.
